alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 7:10PM CST until January 30 at 3:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River at Bayou Manchac Point. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The river will begin to flood property along Bayou Manchac and the Amite River. Amite River Road and Horseshoe Drive will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM CST Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight then begin falling. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 115 PM CST.
